title: (x) "Shostakovich: Piano Concerto No. 1" hybrid sans - Serifedsans {Rainer}
content:
Hi,  
Does anyone know which typeface this is. This is the sans version but I have also seen an equivalent roman version with serifs only on one side of stems etc...

[http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/images/B000VJ2710/sr=8-1/qid=1205426984...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905043138/http:/www.amazon.com/gp/product/images/B000VJ2710/sr=8-1/qid=1205426984/ref=dp_image_0?ie=UTF8&n=5174&s=music&qid=1205426984&sr=8-1 "http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/images/B000VJ2710/sr=8-1/qid=1205426984/ref=dp\_image\_0?ie=UTF8&n=5174&s=music&qid=1205426984&sr=8-1")

Thanks!

 [‹ still of the night](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905043138/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43169 "Go to previous forum topic") [Van Halen ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905043138/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43158 "Go to next forum topic")
author: guermantes

comments.content: It’s a customised Trade Gothic Bold Condensed No.20.

Actually it is [Serifedsans](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905043138/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31148), an extinct David Carson font. Read more [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905043138/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36214) or [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905043138/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41134).
